newsitem.title: USA: Atrion sees $17 mln Q2 gain on nat/gas sale.
newsitem.headline: Atrion sees $17 mln Q2 gain on nat/gas sale.

text.p: Atrion Corp said Thursday that the proposed sale of its natural gas operations is expected to result in gain of about $17 million in the second quarter of 1997.

As previously announced, Atrion said it would sell its natural gas pipeline and marketing subsidiaries to Midcoast Energy Resources Inc for about $39.4 million in cash as part of its strategy to leave the natural gas business and enter the higher-growth medical products business.

The company estimates that, as a result of the $17 million gain, its book value per share following the sale, which is still subject to shareholder approval, will increase to about $16 a share, from $11 per share.
Atrion said its medical products business, which will comprise most of its operations after the gas business is sold, achieved significantly higher revenues and earnings in the first quarter of 1997.
Revenues from these operations rose 157 percent to $7.9 million for the first quarter of 1997 compared with $3.1 million in the year-earlier period.
Net income rose to $480,000 or $0.15 per share, compared with $325,000 or $0.10 per share in the first quarter of 1996.
